description: On 12th March 2020, the Ministry of Education of Peru suspended or postponed the beginning of all face-to-face lessons on universities, technical-productive institutes, and higher education centres, both public and private, until 29th March 2020, allowing schools to begin lessons on 30th March 2020.
type_sub_cat: Higher education institutions (i.e. degree granting institutions)
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries
enforcer: National Government,Other (Please specify in the text box)

description:
On March 12, the Peruvian government suspends face-to-face courses in all schools (public and private) with a duration until March 30. 
On April 1, the measure is extended until May 4.
type_sub_cat: Preschool or childcare facilities (generally for children ages 5 and below)
institution_status: Preschool or childcare facilities closed/locked down

description:
On 12th March 2020, the Ministry of Education of Peru suspended or postponed the beginning of all face-to-face lessons on universities, technical-productive institutes, and higher education centres, both public and private, until 29th March 2020, allowing schools to begin lessons on 30th March 2020.
On 31st March 2020, it was officially extended until 3rd May 2020. UPDATE: The initial duration of the closure of universities and higher education institutions was until March 30th, it has been extended to May 3rd 2020.
type_sub_cat: Higher education institutions (i.e. degree granting institutions)
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries
enforcer: National Government,Other (Please specify in the text box)

description:
On 12th March 2020, the Ministry of Education of Peru suspended or postponed the beginning of all face-to-face lessons on universities, technical-productive institutes, and higher education centres, both public and private, until 29th March 2020, allowing schools to begin lessons on 30th March 2020.
On 31st March 2020, it was officially extended until 3rd May 2020.
On 3rd May 2020, it was extended until the end of the national and sanitary state of emergency (until further notice).

 UPDATE: The restriction of face-to-face lessons on universities and higher education institutions was originally set to last until March 30th. It was then extended until May 3rd. Finally, it has been extended indefinitely (until the end of the state of national and sanitary emergency).
type_sub_cat: Higher education institutions (i.e. degree granting institutions)
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries
enforcer: National Government,Other (Please specify in the text box)

description: On March 15 2020, the Peruvian governement announced the measure of "obligatory social immobilization" (night-time curfew) from 6pm to 5am starting on March 16, 2020 and lasting for with 15 days.
compliance: Mandatory with Legal Penalties (Jail Time),Mandatory with Fines,Mandatory with Exceptions (Please list exceptions in the text entry)

description:
On April 2, the Peruvian government introduces a further, gender-differentiating restriction on mobility and circulation: men are allowed to leave their home on Monday, Wednesday and Friday, women on Tuesday, Thursday and Saturday. Sunday no circulation at all is permitted. The measure applies from April 3 until April 12.
It was cancelled on April 10 due to "lack of efficiency". UPDATE: The original exit restriction per gender was cancelled on April 10.
compliance: Mandatory with Legal Penalties (Jail Time),Mandatory with Fines

description: On 6th April, Peru declares a special curfew for Easter Thursday and Friday.
compliance: Mandatory with Legal Penalties (Jail Time),Mandatory with Fines

description: As from April 10, Peru is enforcing a further restriction on circulation according to which only one member per household may go out for groceries from Monday to Saturday; on Sundays, no circulation at all is allowed. UPDATE: The original gender-based curfew/circulation rule was renounced on April 10 and replaced with the rule that only one household member may leave the for groceries.
compliance: Mandatory with Legal Penalties (Jail Time),Mandatory with Fines

description: On April 2, the Peruvian government introduces a further , gender-differentiating restriction on mobility and circulation: men are allowed to leave their home on Monday, Wednesday and Friday, women on Tuesday, Thursday and Saturday. Sunday no circulation at all is permitted. The measure applies as from April 3 until April 12.
compliance: Mandatory with Legal Penalties (Jail Time),Mandatory with Fines

description: On September 16th, 2020, the Peruvian government announced that the curfew on Sundays will remain on the provinces with targeted lockdown.
target_geog_level: One or more other geographical or administrative unit within a country (e.g. county)

description: Peru declares a nation-wide sanitary emergency because of the presence of COVID-19 with a duration of 90 days commencing March 11, 2020.
On March 15, Peru declares nation-wide state of emergency commencing March 16 for the duration of 15 days due to the significant impacts of the coronavirus on the life of the nation.

On 11th March, 2020, the Ministry of Health of Peru passed a resolution that requires every single traveller entering the country by any mean (air, land, fluvial, sea) to fill an affidavit stating information such as the countries they have been in the last 15 days, if they present some COVID-19-like symptoms and their personal data (telephone number, address in Peru).
type_sub_cat: Travel History Form (e.g. documents where traveler has recently been)
target_geog_level: All countries
enforcer: National Government,Ministry/Department of Health,Other (Please specify in the text box)

description: On March 15, the Peruvian government anounced the closure of all borders for the duration of 15 days, commencing on March 16, 2020.
target_geog_level: All countries
compliance: Mandatory with Exceptions (Please list exceptions in the text entry)

description: On April 4, Peruvian and Ecuadorian military entered into a bilateral agreement in order to stop clandestine and uncontrolled border-crossngs at the Peruvian-Ecuadorian border. Border-crossers` health is monitored.
type_sub_cat: Health Screenings (e.g. temperature checks)

description: On March 15, Peru declares a nation-wide state of emergency lasting until April 26. UPDATE: The original quarantine has been extended to April 26
target_geog_level: All countries
compliance: Mandatory with Exceptions (Please list exceptions in the text entry)

description: Peru announced a ban on flights coming from Europe, amid concerns of the new COVID-19 mutation that first appeared on the United Kingdom. The ban starts on December 22nd, 2020, and it is initially for two weeks. Flights from Peru to Europe are still allowed, and cargo flights from Europe can also arrive.
type_sub_cat: Total border crossing ban
target_geog_level: One or more regional groupings

description: On April 1, the Peruvian President Vizcarra anouced the elaboration of maps showing areas with COVID-19 infections in order to concentrate isolations in affected areas.
target_geog_level: One or more cities within a country

description: On April 4, the Peruvian Ministry of Health launched the app "Peru en tus manos" designed to provide a self-test for possible COVID-19-infections. Users of the app pertaining to risk groups can also be contacted by the competent authority. The app is not mandatory and is not designed as a tracker-app.
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: As part of the declaration of state of emergency, on March 16th, the president of Peru announced that interprovincial travel is suspended during the emergency, in all means (land, air, fluvial). Initially, the measure will last 15 days. Transport is, however, guaranteed for essential workers identified with their credentials and for transportation of goods.
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries
enforcer: National Government,Military,Police,Other (Please specify in the text box)

description: On March 15th 2020, the Peruvian government announced an "obligatory social isolation" (Lockdown) for all citizens/residents. They can only leave their homes for eight main reasons, related to the production and purchase of groceries; pharmaceutical products and first necessity goods; health-related visits to health centres; return to main residence; assistance and care of elderly, children, adolescents and handicapped or vulnerable people; media (journalists) and call centers; fuel (distribution and purchase); and providing and using financial services (e.g. banks).
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries
compliance: Mandatory with Legal Penalties (Jail Time),Mandatory with Fines,Mandatory with Exceptions (Please list exceptions in the text entry)

description: On 26th June 2020, the Government of Peru announced the end of the nationwide lockdown and the start of a targeted lockdown per region, where different measures will be enforced. The measure begins 1st July, 2020 initial list of regions includes Arequipa, Ica, Junín, Huánuco, San Martín, Madre de Dios and Áncash, and will be reviewed constantly. Also, those aged 14 or less and 65 or over must remain locked down, regardless of their region of residence.
target_geog_level: One or more provinces within a country
target_province: Arequipa; Ica; Junín, Huánuco; San Martín; Madre de Dios; Áncash,
enforcer: National Government,Ministry/Department of Health,Military,Provincial/State Government,Municipal Government,Police

description: On 26th June 2020, the Government of Peru announced the end of the nationwide lockdown and the start of a targeted lockdown per region, where different measures will be enforced. The measure begins 1st July, 2020 initial list of regions includes Arequipa, Ica, Junín, Huánuco, San Martín, Madre de Dios and Áncash, and will be reviewed constantly. Also, those aged 14 or less and 65 or over must remain locked down, regardless of their region of residence. UPDATE: The targeted lockdown was extended on 31st July, 2020, for an additional month, but the provinces listed changed.
target_geog_level: One or more provinces within a country
target_province: Arequipa; Ica; Junín, Huánuco; San Martín; Madre de Dios; Áncash,
enforcer: National Government,Ministry/Department of Health,Military,Provincial/State Government,Municipal Government,Police

description: On 31st July, 2020, the Government of Peru announced the extension of the targeted lockdown per region until the end of August. The conditions remain the same from the previous targeted lockdown; however, the list of regions was changed, and for the first time, provinces within regions were included. The regions listed where all their provinces are included are: Arequipa, Ica, Junín, Huánuco and San Martín. The regions where some provinces are included are: Madre de Dios (Tambopata); Áncash (Santa, Casma, Huaraz); Moquegua (Mariscal Nieto, Ilo); Tacna (Tacna); Cusco (Cusco, La Convención), Puno (San Román, Puno); Huancavelica (Huancavelica); Cajamarca (Cajamarca, Jaén, San Ignacio); Amazonas (Bagua, Condorcanqui, Utcubamba); Apurímac (Abancay, Andahuaylas). UPDATE: The government extended the targeted lockdown on August 28th, 2020, but changed the regions and provinces included.
target_geog_level: One or more provinces within a country
target_province: Arequipa (all provinces); Ica (all); Junín (all); Huánuco (all); San Martín (all); Madre de Dios (Tambopata); Áncash (Santa, Casma, Huaraz); Moquegua (Mariscal Nieto, Ilo); Tacna (Tacna); Cusco (Cusco, La Convención), Puno (San Román, Puno); Huancavelica (Huancavelica); Cajamarca (Cajamarca, Jaén, San Ignacio); Amazonas (Bagua, Condorcanqui, Utcubamba); Apurímac (Abancay, Andahuaylas).
enforcer: National Government,Ministry/Department of Health,Military,Provincial/State Government,Municipal Government,Police

description: On 28th August, 2020, the Peruvian Government announced an extension of the targeted lockdown until the end of September. The measure includes 46 provinces from the following regions: Amazonas (3); Áncash (4); Apurímac (1); Arequipa (4); Ayacucho (4); Cajamarca (2); Huancavelica (3); Huánuco (4); Ica (4); Junín (3); La Libertad (6); Lima (4, does not include the Metropolitan Region); Madre de Dios (1); Pasco (2).
target_geog_level: One or more other geographical or administrative unit within a country (e.g. county)
enforcer: National Government,Ministry/Department of Health,Military,Provincial/State Government,Municipal Government,Police

description: Peru is readying an economic stimulus package worth around 90 billion soles ($ 26.41 billion), divided into three phases: 1) containment of the disease, 2) ensuring of payment chains by granting credit guarantees and 3) reactivation of production.
type_text: The policy concerns a an economic stimulus package designed by the government to respond to the Corona-related economic crisis. This investment equals 12 % of the country´s GDP. GDP

description: On March 31, Peru anounced the possibility of affiliates to the national bond fund (AFP - Administradoras Privadas e Fondos de Pensiones ) to withdraw up to 2,000 soles in case they have not been working in the last 12 months. Active workers/contributors can skip their contribution in the months of April and May.
type_text: Concerns the National Bond Fund; affiliates out of work in the last 12 months are enabled to withdraw 2,000 soles (1000 on month, 1000 the following). Active workers can skip their contribution payments in the months of april and may.

description: On April 7th, the Peruvian Ministry of Labour anounced a special payment of S/ 380 soles for vulnerable independent workers for which they can apply through the website bonoindependiente.pe. It is shall reach approximately 780 000 families.
type_text: The finacial aid is directed to vulnerable independent workers and consists in a payment of 380 soles upon solicting the aid and meeting the criteria.

description: On March 21, the Peruvian Ministry of Education launched an educational song for children in various indigenous languages to promote hygiene standards and raise awareness for the spread of the coronavirus among the young population.
enforcer: Other (Please specify in the text box)

description: On August 30th, the Peruvian government launched a national public awareness campaign named "El COVID no mata solo. No seamos cómplices" (COVID does not kill alone. Let's not be accomplices). The impact campaign, which will be used in TV, printed press, street billboards, social networks, radio, etc., aims at changing behaviour to reduce the incidence of contagions through social meetings. This is the first part of a three-stage campaign.
type_sub_cat: Disseminating information related to COVID-19 to the public that is reliable and factually accurate
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries
enforcer: National Government,Provincial/State Government,Municipal Government,New (COVID-19 specific) Task Force,Other (Please specify in the text box)

description: On June 15th, the president of Peru announced a new campaign named "Primero mi salud" (My health first), which is aimed at emphasizing self care measures (hand wash, sanitizing, mask wearing, social distancing) in order to protect others. The new campaign targets everyone, and specially those that have to return to work since the campaign starts at the same time that shopping centres and conglomerates reopen their doors as part of Phase 2 of the economic reactivation.
type_sub_cat: Disseminating information related to COVID-19 to the public that is reliable and factually accurate
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: On June 15th, the president of Peru announced a new campaign named "Primero mi salud" (My health first), which is aimed at emphasizing self care measures (hand wash, sanitizing, mask wearing, social distancing) in order to protect others. The new campaign targets everyone, and specially those that have to return to work since the campaign starts at the same time that shopping centres and conglomerates reopen their doors as part of Phase 2 of the economic reactivation. UPDATE: The announcement on August 30th of the new campaign "El COVID no mata solo" effectively ended the "Primero mi salud" campaign.
type_sub_cat: Disseminating information related to COVID-19 to the public that is reliable and factually accurate
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description:
On March, 11, Peru is enforcing a two-week quarantine on all passengers, including Peruvian nationals arriving from or having visited countries which are selected and listed by the Centro
de Epidemiología, Prevención y Control de Enfermedades (Center of Empidemology, Disease Prevention and Control), namely Spain, France, Italy and China.
type_sub_cat: Self-Quarantine (i.e. quarantine at home)
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: Starting March 16, Peru, for a duration of 15 days, restricts commercial activities in the following manner: all shops and and other commercial establishments are closed aprt from those that provide food products, toiletries, products and goods of first necessity, pharmaceutical and medical products, optican or orthopaedic products and combustible. The competent authority is reserved the right to close further establishments in case of mainfestation of risk of contagion. Restarurants etc. are closed.
type_sub_cat: Retail Businesses
institution_status: This type of business  ("Retail Businesses") is closed/locked down

description: On April 8th, the National Institute for Prisons (Instituto Nacional Penitenciario) anounced that no new detainees have been accepted since April 7th and that this measures continues during the Peruvian State of Emergency.
type: Restriction and Regulation of Government Services
institution_status: This service is no longer provided by the government

description: On March 15, the Peruvia government anounced an internal border restriction, limiting the available trasportation services: in urban areas public transport is limited by 50 % and only allowed to be used for the activities permitted under the curfew. Interprovincial transport is suspendes entirely.
type: Restriction and Regulation of Government Services
institution_status: This service is no longer provided by the government

description: As of March 13, the Peruvian goverment suspends public gatherings > 300 persons with a duration of 90 days.
As from March 16 2020 until March 30, Peru prohibits parades, patronal festivals, any other religious or civil festive activities and any other gathering that endangers public health.
compliance: Mandatory with Legal Penalties (Jail Time),Mandatory with Fines

description: On August 12th, 2020, the Peruvian Government issued a decree making explicit the prohibition of social (friends and family) meetings in private places (such as houses).
type_sub_cat: Events at private residencies restricted (e.g. parties held at home)

description: On March 18th, 2020, the Peruvian Government announced that starting March 19th, 2020, private vehicles will not be allowed to circulate in the country, except for those of essential workers that will require a special permit to use their cars.
type_sub_cat: Restrictions on  private vehicles in public circulation
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: On March 18th, 2020, the Peruvian Government announced that starting March 19th, 2020, private vehicles will not be allowed to circulate in the country, except for those of essential workers that will require a special permit to use their cars. UPDATE: On May 23rd, 2020, the Peruvian government announced that private vehicles are allowed to circulate again under certain conditions, ending the total prohibition.
type_sub_cat: Restrictions on  private vehicles in public circulation
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: On May 23rd, 2020, the Peruvian government announced that private vehicles are allowed to circulate again, but only to buy groceries, medicines, to go to work (only for activities allowed in the first phase of economic reactivation) and for medical emergencies. A special permit is required and circulation is restricted only to the district of residence and only to one passenger per car.
type_sub_cat: Restrictions on  private vehicles in public circulation
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries
enforcer: Military,Police,Other (Please specify in the text box)

description: On May 23rd, 2020, the Peruvian government announced that private vehicles are allowed to circulate again, but only to buy groceries, medicines, to go to work (only for activities allowed in the first phase of economic reactivation) and for medical emergencies. A special permit is required and circulation is restricted only to the district of residence and only to one passenger per car. UPDATE: On June 27th 2020, it was announced that, starting July 1st, a special permit was no longer necessary and that circulation is no longer restricted to the district of residence, except in the regions where a targeted lockdown is enforced, which will remain under this policy.
type_sub_cat: Restrictions on  private vehicles in public circulation
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries
enforcer: Military,Police,Other (Please specify in the text box)

description: On September 16th, 2020, the Peruvian government announced that on the provinces without targeted lockdown, private vehicles cannot circulate on Sundays. The policy is set to last until the end of September, at minimum.

target_geog_level: One or more other geographical or administrative unit within a country (e.g. county)
